review_title: Best Company I have Ever Worked For
pros: Supportive management, amazing on boarding process, great induction, family feel, friendly and kind colleagues, experience and knowledge sharing is the culture of the organisation. With a strong emphasis on customer service and providing top level outcomes for our clients.

Tenet is part of the wider CPL Group, a charity with a charitable ethos. It has a flexible approach to working arrangements and part time colleagues such as me, have the ability to work one, two, three or four days per week in roles which are genuinely part time. Support is always on hand and the approach to training / CPD is excellent.
cons: Can't think of any. As a Procurement Consultant, you are likely to be based either permanently in your clients' offices or working from home - a mindset that you need to get into ... but you are not forgotten about (unlike some client secondments).

pros:
Good salary and lovely people to work with.
Management are very approachable and open door policy. Very supportive.
Regular team updates (weekly) on Teams as all consultants work from home or respective client sites.
Transfer of knowledge open with all staff and there is a 'family' feel to the organisation.
Planned CPD throughout the year either in Manchester or on line webinars (white paper).
cons: I have to say that there are no cons that come to mind.

review_title: A great place to work, where hard work and performance is recognised
pros: A great place to work which encourages you to develop your skills and build your career. Hard work and performance is recognised from the top. Tenet values its staff and encourages a healthy work/life balance.
cons: During busy months the hours are long, volume of work is high and timescales are demanding. However, this is acknowledged by management and often rewarded.

pros: Very supportive, especially for training opportunities and flexibility of workplace and the use of templates to help our work with clients is great
cons: The workload is constantly busy, there is less chance of building in 'thought' time for some work, but planning and sharing with the rest of the team gets us through the volume of work. Time flies when your busy !

review_title: Great company that listens to and supports their employees
pros:
You are involved in a wide range of projects
You have support from top level down
Flexible working means you can balance work and home life
Great customer base where you can really make a difference
Opportunities to enhance your learning through funded training
cons: There aren't any negatives to working here.

pros: Supportive management starting at the very top, knowledgeable and helpful colleagues , Great support and backing for self and professional development. Adapted well throughout the pandemic to support staff remotely!
cons: Remote working is not for everyone.

review_title: A caring employer who is people orientated.
job_title: Managing Director in Salford, North West England, England
pros: Variety, Support, Training & Development, Employer who cares.
No whatsoever. Would not recommend working here.
cons: No room for progression. Blatant favoritism.
